breeze.translate: ветер, бриз, ветерок, легкий ветерок, ссора, веять, промчаться, продувать
examples: A breeze sprang up.
The breeze fanned her hair.
All in all, the test was a breeze.
Look who just breezed in!
The sea breeze blows furiously.
She breezed through the test.
Her hair was blowing in the breeze.
A soft breeze pulsed the air.
Setup of the new software is a breeze.
A cold breeze was blowing hard.
A warm breeze caressed her face.
A cold breeze prickled his face.
A breeze blew the curtains inwards.
He breezed past us without so much as a nod.
The breeze flapped the sails.
A cool breeze rippled the water.
Flags were waving in the breeze.
The breeze murmured in the pines.
The breeze fluttered the curtains.
There was a light easterly breeze.
The flag was flowing in the breeze.
The breeze made the curtains flutter.
A gentle breeze stirred the curtains.
The trees swayed gently in the breeze.
The flags were flapping in the breeze.
Her long skirt billowed in the breeze.
The flag fluttered in the light breeze.
A spanking breeze is a boon to sailors.
The flowers were nodding in the breeze.
The branches moved gently in the breeze.
example_translate: А вообще-то контрольная оказалась очень лёгкой.
Установка нового программного обеспечения не представляет труда.
Его лицо покалывало от холодного ветра.
Он пролетел мимо нас, не удосужившись даже кивнуть.
Вода покрылась рябью от холодного ветра.
Её длинная юбка развевалась на ветру.
Сильный, свежий ветер — это благо для моряков.
